data.title: Experimental Hip Hop Archives
data.text:
L’Orange is teaming up with Interplanetary Master Kool Keith for the collaborative album Time? Astonishing! which is due for release on July 24th via Mello Music Group (pre-order).The album is entirely produced by L’Orange and features contributions from Blu, Open Mike Eagle, MC Paul Barman, Mr. Lif among others. Lat week the pair released the first single “The Traveler” which features […]

Read more

Check out the double A-side single, ‘Facety 2:11’ / ‘Like A Drum’ which sees Roots Manuva recruit two of electronic music’s most formidable talents, Four Tet, and Machinedrum. ‘Facety 2:11’ is produced by fellow UK maverick Four Tet. ‘Facety’ is patois slang for someone being rude – a barefaced cheek. Infectious hip hop drums and […]

Read more

Back in the summer, Seattle duo Shabazz Palaces released one of the best albums of the year, their first since 2011’s brilliant ‘Black Up’. Earlier this week, they released a new track titled “Ham Sandwich,” it’s a short but ever so sweet, two-minutes of dope goodness. As is standard for the duo, the song is choke full […]

Read more

Young Fathers have dropped a new single, Soon Come Soon, the first new release since their Mercury Prize winning debut album, DEAD. According to the band’s label Some Come Soon was created when they got together “for a wild night in a studio ran by a man called Daddy Kev. Under the influence of surf, skunk and […]

Read more

clipping have just dropped something unexpected, a new two-track single. The tracks entitled “Something They Don’t Know” and “Mouth,” fall off the same experimental branch that we’ve come to expect from them. The two new tracks are posse cuts the trio made with a bunch of close friends, including Signor Benedick the Moor, Nocando, and Open Mike Eagle. […]

Read more

Blue Daisy returns to us with a new EP, entitled Mermaids and it’s an impressive addition to his catalogue. He’s been putting together a less aggressive sound in some recent tracks like “Fallin Circles” and on the title track from the EP . But he still also maintains that signature rugged, sinister sound that made us […]

Read more

Experimental rapper and singer DonChristian Jones has shared his new track “Green Dream”. Like his recent mixtape, Renzo Piano this one takes heavy influence from R&B. “Green Dream” features an atmospheric production from Suicideyear and somewhat tongue-in-cheek rapping from DonChristian. “It’s satirical in that I’m rapping about luxury and consumer success, of which I know little about,” […]

Read more

Hal Williams aka Pyramid Vritra is about to drop a new EP. According to Stones Throw, Palace is 6 tracks, in the concept of the record as the palace, a corridor of music, with each track representing a different room. The main goal for Vritra with this EP was to shift the attention from the beats and […]

Read more
